greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = minimal number of consecutive integers required which when summed make n.
comment: Zeros occur where no number of consecutive integers can be summed to make n; This only happens where n is an even power of two, or zero itself.
Entries where this sequence is nonzero are in A138591.
link: Ray Chandler, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
example: 20 = 2 + 3 + 4 + 5 + 6; No shorter sequence of consecutive integers sums to 20 and so a(20) = the number of elements in {2,3,4,5,6} = 5
15 = 4 + 5 + 6, but also 15 = 7 + 8, so a(15) = 2, since this is the minimum.
results.author: _Carl R. White_, Jul 22 2009
